subject: Re: [junit] Misunderstanding the use of the Assume Class
msgSnippet: Bruce, Sorry to be a while getting back to you.  Can you post the stack trace that you get in Eclipse? David Saff
messageBody:
Bruce,

Sorry to be a while getting back to you. Can you post the stack trace
that you get in Eclipse?

David Saff

On Thu, Jul 15, 2010 at 4:16 PM, Bruce Wobbe <brewsterw@...> wrote:
> Thanks David, I don't think it's ant as I am getting the same issue with
> eclipse
>
> On Thu, Jul 15, 2010 at 12:40 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> Bruce,
>>
>> What you've done looks good from the JUnit side at first glance. I
>> wonder if the ant team is maintaining their own copy of part of the
>> JUnit infrastructure, which handles assumptions in a different way?
>> It might be worth asking the ant team. Good luck,
>>
>> David Saff
>>
>>
>> On Wed, Jul 14, 2010 at 9:00 PM, Bruce <brewsterw@...<brewsterw%40yahoo.com>>
>> wrote:
>> > Hi,
>> > I want to use the Assume class to dynamically turn off some tests. There
>> are tests I want run when we run full regression but not at other times. I
>> have implemented an assume line that I thought would ignore the test as
>> follows
>> > String buildType = System.getenv(BUILD_TYPE);
>> > Assume.assumeNotNull(buildType);
>> > Assume.assumeTrue(buildType.equals(DAILY_BUILD));
>> >
>> > The test runs and exits when it reaches the assumeNotNull as I expected.
>> However when all my tests finish I get an error in the junit report
>> > build.xml:1100: JunitTests failed. Check "C:\DEV\junitreport
>> >
>> > Inside of the report I have the following
>> >
>> >          <error message="got: <[null]>, expected: each not null"
>> type="org.junit.internal.AssumptionViolatedException">        at
>> com.MyCode.InclusionFileProcessTest.testLoadLargeListbyId(InclusionFileProcessTest.java:352)
>>
>> > </error>
>> >
>> > To me ignoring the test would mean just that, nothing happens. Am I doing
>> something wrong? I have recently upgraded from junit 3.x to 4.x have I
>> missed something in the upgrade?
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> > ------------------------------------
>> >
>> > Yahoo! Groups Links
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>>
>>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
